page.title: 01Kennoway and District
page.content:
The village of Kennoway is situated in a rural area of{Fife Region}in the east of Scotland. It stands on the A916, 9 miles from Kirkcaldy and 20 miles from Dundee.
Immediately to the north of the village lie the two hamlets of {Bonnybank}and{Baintown.}The rest of the area is open countryside given over almost entirely to farming. The land slopes away to the south-east towards the{Firth of Forth}and the town of{Leven,}a popular holiday resort, which is 2 miles distant.
The village has a population of around 5500.
Early closing day is{Wednesday.}
